a_sick_lucie.description: Lucie clears her airways with a bowl of steaming water.  Felix is amused.
a_sick_lucie.title: A Sick Lucie

berkeley_01.description: It's been raining a lot, which makes us eager to get out on the days it isn't.  He're we're walking near the Berkeley marina.
berkeley_01.title: Berkeley 1

berkeley_02.description: Felix walks everywhere now, as long as time isn't of the essence.
berkeley_02.title: Berkeley 2

berkeley_04.description: The Adventure Playground near the Berkeley marina is awesome.  You have to sign a liability waiver to get in, because everything's rusty and splintery and just dangerous enough to be a ton of fun.
berkeley_04.title: Berkeley 4

berkeley_05.description: If you collect a few rusty nails at the Adventure Playground, you can return them to the attendant, who gives you paint. You can paint anything in the playground. They also hand out saws, hammers and nails, which can be used in designated areas, and which ensure a never-ending supply of rusty nails to collect.
berkeley_05.title: Berkeley 5

berkeley_06.description: Felix can't get enough of boats.
berkeley_06.title: Berkeley 6

berkeley_07.description: Felix keeps a supply of toys in his backpack.
berkeley_07.title: Berkeley 7

berkeley_09.description: Contrary to all known laws of toddler nature, Felix prefers to inspect mud puddles from a distance.
berkeley_09.title: Berkeley 9

berkeley_10.description: Felix has Dean's sense of balance.  Thankfully.
berkeley_10.title: Berkeley 10

berkeley_12.description: Felix has a sailor's instinct for knowing that it's better in the boat than in the water.
berkeley_12.title: Berkeley 12

berkeley_13.description: Which deck is the poop deck?
berkeley_13.title: Berkeley 13

evan1.description: We kept Evan for a day.  He's clearly Felix's best friend.  When you ask Felix who his friends are, he starts the list with Nounours and Evan.
evan1.title: Evan 1

evan2.description: Evan tends to wander.  You can send Felix to herd him back.  It's rather charming.
evan2.title: Evan 2

evan3.description: Lucie, Evan and Felix hard at Play-Doh.  Felix's Bob the Builder Play-Doh set is the most used of all his Christmas presents.   At least once a day he asks to play with "Bob".  We're kind of tired of "Bob" and hide it, but he always manages to find it.  He'll go around the house calling out "Bob?  Boooooob!" until he comes across it.
evan3.title: Evan 3

evan4.description: Quiet time.  Lucie and Felix discuss underpants versus diapers.  Felix has not indicated a desire to jump that particular puddle yet.
evan4.title: Evan 4

evan5.description: Evan was a little saint about getting his teeth brushed.  He even let Felix do it.   Felix, on the other hand, has days where we have to put him in a headlock.
evan5.title: Evan 5

kiki.description: Felix and Lucie play with Kiki, a doll sent by Babushka (Grandma Francoise), along with lots of homemade outfits.
kiki.title: Kiki

museum1.description: Felix and Dean at the Discovery Museum in Sausalito.  San Francisco sure is pretty.
museum1.title: Museum 1

museum2.description: Felix inspects the Discovery Museum's jetty for throwable rocks.
museum2.title: Museum 2

museum3.description: Felix at the Discovery Museum's Play-Doh table.   He's not good with crowds:  when a gaggle of kids descend on the table, he puts his stuff down and watches them.
museum3.title: Museum 3

museum4.description: Carrying a sleeping Felix from the car to the bed.
museum4.title: Museum 4

description:
The good news is that Felix is completely over the flu. The bad news is that Lucie has had the flu and now has a sinus infection. The fun times just aren't stopping this holiday season.

Dean's been on vacation for the entire winter holidays -- more than two weeks -- which has been good because he's been keeping Felix a lot while Lucie's hacking up a lung. The guys have been doing some bonding.

On the language front, new words are popping every day. We are not keeping an exhaustive list, but here's an idea:

  • French words - ca (this), joujou (toy), cadeau (present), tartine (bread with butter and jam), couche (diaper), dents (teeth), sable (sand), pont (bridge), 'nel (tunnel), docteur (doctor), coupe (to cut, his only French verb).
  • English words - what's that?, that, there, over there, see, want, wake up, hug, cry, sad, wet, dark, big, stuck, dirty, high, hot, cold, closed, open, hard (as in difficult), chair (also meaning "to sit"), crayon (also meaning "to draw"), backpack, door, cooking, steam, hair, hand, feet, shirt, boots, rain (also meaning "umbrella"), sky, moon, star, light, tree, truck, cup, milk, water, cow, pig, fish, bird, light, top, ladder, guy.
  • French to English - Except for a very few exceptions, Felix uses either a French or an English word for something, but not both. Lately, a few of his French words have been replaced by English ones: main has been replaced by hand, sale by dirty, l'eau by water, jus by juice, assis by chair, chat by cat.
  • Disappearing baby signs - Almost all of Felix's baby signs have fallen into disuse. A very few remain:
    [fingers tapping palm] more, for emphasis... especially useful when his mouth is full of whatever he wants more of.
    [palms opening] book, for clarification... his "book"and his "bottle" sound a lot alike ("bo"), and both are things he requests when tired.
    [hand to ear] did you hear that sound?, for speed... coupled with saying "what's that?"
title: January 4
